keyword: how many calories in a cup of ground beef
title: How Many Calories in a Cup of Ground Beef?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a cup of ground beef, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in a Cup of Ground Beef?
assumptions: 80% lean ground beef, cooked (pan-broiled), drained of fat, crumbled; 1 cup ≈ 200 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by lean percentage, cooking method, fat drainage, and portion density. Check labels or use a scale for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One cup of cooked 80% lean ground beef provides ~508 kcal and ~52 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a cup of cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: About 508 kcal for 1 cup (200 g) of 80% lean, cooked and drained.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a cup of ground beef?
faqs.a: Approximately 52 g of protein per cup of cooked 80% lean ground beef.

faqs.q: Does lean percentage affect calories in ground beef?
faqs.a: Yes—90% lean has ~200 kcal per 100 g vs. 254 for 80% lean, lowering totals.

faqs.q: Are these values for raw or cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: Cooked and drained; raw has similar calories but cooking reduces weight by ~20-30%.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a cup of ground beef?
faqs.a: About 32 g total fat, including 12 g saturated, for 80% lean cooked.
